channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Alienware's x15 and x17 cram Intel H-series CPUs and RTX 30 graphics into thin frames
item.description: Alienware's new x15 and x17 models are its thinnest gaming laptops yet.

item.title: Uber and Lyft rides are pricier due to a lack of drivers (and the waits are longer, too)
item.description: Uber and Lyft rides have been almost twice as expensive, because the ride-hailing companies have been having difficulties meeting demand.

item.title: Tesla's revamped Model S and X will feature RDNA 2 GPUs, AMD confirms
item.description: Tesla's refreshed Model S and X will run AMD's RDNA 2 graphics.

item.title: AMD makes a bigger play for gaming laptops with Radeon RX 6000M GPUs
item.description: AMD is finally bringing its RDNA 2 technology to notebooks. During its Computex keynote today, the company announced the Radeon RX 6000M series of mobile GPUs.

item.title: You can buy AMD's Ryzen 5000 chips with Radeon graphics on August 5th
item.description: Today at Computex, AMD officially announced that consumers will be able to buy the 5600G and 5700G on August 5th for $259 and $359, respectively.

item.title: 'Knockout City' is free for new players until they reach level 25
item.description: Starting this week, Knockout City is free to play until you reach level 25 in-game.

item.title: David Lynch's 'Dune' will be released on 4K Blu-ray in August
item.description: On August 31st, Arrow Films will rerelease Lynch's "worst" film on 4K Blu-ray in the US, UK and Canada.

item.title: Zombies will soon invade 'Watch Dogs: Legion'
item.description: You and three friends can hack your way through the undead starting on June 1st.

item.title: Google's speedier internet standard is now an actual standard
item.description: Google's QUIC data technology is now an official internet standard, potentially improving connections worldwide.

item.title: Xbox has a two-year console exclusive on Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos
item.description: But you'll still need to pay a license fee for Atmos audio on Xbox consoles or PC.

item.title: Microsoft Store listing reveals 'Two Point Hospital' follow-up
item.description: Two Point Campus, the next game from Two Point Studios, has leaked thanks to a too early listing on the Microsoft Store.

item.title: The best grilling gear
item.description: Here’s a list of the best grilling gear you can buy -- including Traeger, Weber and Kamado Joe grills -- as chosen by Engadget editors.

item.title: LG has reportedly stopped making smartphones
item.description: The company still had contracts to fulfill after announcing plans to shut down its mobile business.

item.title: Google Photos' free unlimited storage ends tomorrow
item.description: Google Photos' free unlimited storage ends tomorrow — here's what you need to know, including a few alternatives.

item.title: This bag has lasted me nearly 20 years
item.description: How do you know if a bag is really going to stand the test of time? You don’t, and so you often have to take the maker’s claims of longevity at face value. This is why we felt it was important to take a look at a backpack that really has lasted beyond any reasonable expectation. Senior Editor Dan Cooper bought this The North Face backpack before he went to college. 17 years later, and it’s only now starting to show its age.

item.title: Instant Pot Ultra cookers are 50 percent off at Amazon for Memorial Day
item.description: Instant Pot Ultra cookers are half price at Amazon as part of a Memorial Day sale.

item.title: Save over $100 on this portable personal air conditioner
item.description: The EvaSMART 2 is a compact portable AC unit that doubles as an air purifier and humidifier.

item.title: Sigma fp L hands-on: Tiny camera, big sensor, enormous compromises
item.description: Sigma has crammed a 61-megapixel full-frame sensor into the tiny fp L body, but that has meant some big compromises to handling and performance.

item.title: Xiaomi says it can fully charge a phone in eight minutes
item.description: Xiaomi has demonstrated its new Hyper Charge tech fully charging a 4,000mAH phone battery in eight minutes.

item.title: The best 60-percent keyboards you can buy
item.description: Here's a list of the best 60-percent keyboards you can buy, as chosen by Engadget editors.

item.title: The Morning After: A surprising cloudy day on Mars
item.description: Today’s headlines: The first look at a cloudy day on Mars, Apple delays paid podcast subscription launch to June and Tesla may have to ship Texas-made EVs out of state to sell them to Texans.

item.title: Google says it won't build Privacy Sandbox backdoors
item.description: Google has said it will not bypass the Privacy Sandbox rules it plans to impose next year in order to end third-party cookie tracking.

item.title: Android 12 will force apps through the official share menu
item.description: With Android 12, Google will stop third-party apps from replacing the stock share dialog.

item.title: Intel's latest 11th-gen CPU lets ultraportables hit 5GHz
item.description: Thin and light computers will finally cross the 5GHz barrier with Intel's latest flagship 11th-gen U-series chip.

item.title: The best dark matter map to date raises questions about the universe
item.description: Scientists have released the most precise map of dark matter to date, but it only serves to highlight mysteries in the universe.
